abstract: John F. Welch Jr., the legendary former chief executive of General Electric, was throwing rapid-fire bouquets and brickbats Wednesday morning during his turn as guest host of CNBC’s Squawk Box. Perhaps most notably, he said Jeff Immelt, his successor at G.E., had suffered a “credibility crash” after the giant conglomerate severely missed earnings expectations last week.
lead_paragraph: John F. Welch Jr., the legendary former chief executive of General Electric, was throwing rapid-fire bouquets and brickbats Wednesday morning during his turn as guest host of CNBC’s Squawk Box. Perhaps most notably, he said Jeff Immelt, his successor at G.E., had suffered a “credibility crash” after the giant conglomerate severely missed earnings expectations last week.
